details.content: Security deployed outside a counting center in Kalaburagi ahead of counting of votes for Karnataka Elections 2018

#Visuals from a counting center (Maharani College) in Bengaluru ahead of counting of votes for #KarnatakaElections2018; additional security has been deployed across 38 counting centres in the state pic.twitter.com/ehXdk6hvgr

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

We have deployed Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) in strong rooms, adequate security personnel presence will be there at all counting centres to ensure law and order is maintained: Chief Election Commissioner OP Rawat
50,000 police personnel deployed across 38 counting centres in state,11,000 in Bengaluru alone.
One Rapid Action Force (RAF) company and 20 Karnataka State Reserve Police (KSRP) companies also deployed in Bengaluru.

Reports of postal ballots found in a hotel in Badami is untrue says ECI. "alleged room neither had such ballot papers nor any proof of their existence there, despite dat d local police have registered an FIR that an instruction manual was found in d room," ECI said in a statement

— Anusha Ravi (@anusharavi10) May 15, 2018

Bellary: BJP's B.Sriramalu prays ahead of counting of votes. He is contesting against CM Siddaramaiah from Badami constituency. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/ImhVnVJXpg

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

#Visuals from the strong room(where EVMs are kept) at a counting center (Maharani College) in Bengaluru, counting of votes for #KarnatakaElections2018 to begin shortly. pic.twitter.com/2oNTZVdQU8

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018
JDS's HD Kumaraswamy offers prayers at Adichunchanagiri Mahasamsthana Math in Nagamangala ahead of counting of votes

Senior party leaders will decide on this, but we are confident and hope to form Government on our own: Dr.Yathindra, Congress candidate from Varuna and son of CM Siddaramaiah on possibility of post poll alliance with JDS
Counting begins in 38 centres across Karnataka.

Counting of votes for #KarnatakaElections2018 begins, postal ballots to be counted first. Visuals from a strong room (where EVMs & postal ballots are kept) in #Kalaburagi's Afzalpur. pic.twitter.com/Pwyg6Cy01M

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

First result goes to BJP. Umakanth Kotiyan wins Moodabidri by 22000 votes @NewIndianXpress #KarnatakaElection2018

— KIRAN PRAKASH (@MSKiranPrakash) May 15, 2018
"Correct position will be known at 11-11.30 am. I am going to discuss the possibility of alliance with JD(S) with Ghulam Nabi Azad and Ashok Gehlot," says Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress.
BJP edging closer to the magic number, currently leads at 106 constituencies.
Kundapur BJP candidate Halady Srinivas Shetty maintains lead against Congress' Rakesh Malli with 6,278 votes at the end of second round of counting.
Bhatkal constituency BJP candidate is leading by 5730 votes in the third around over Congress candidate.
BJP's Bharat Shetty leads with 7136 votes in Mangaluru North.
"There is no question of alliance with JDS as we are already crossing 112 seats," says Sadananda Gowda, BJP.

details.content: After completion of fourth round of counting, CM Siddaramaiah leads by 2100 votes in Badami.

BJP's first victory comes in the form of Umanath Kotyan's win in Moodabidiri, Dakshina Kannada. Congratulations!

details.title: Veerappa Moily says too early to concede defeat
details.content: Too early to concede defeat: Senior Congress leader Veerappa Moily
Badami: B Sriramulu leads CM Siddaramaiah by 420 votes
Despite all the confidence, he expressed about contesting from two seats, Karnataka's sitting Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is trailing in Home turf Chamundeshwari but is leading by a thread in Badami.
Siddaramaiah is the first Chief Minister in Karnataka to have completed a full term in office in forty years.

In Badami, Siddaramaiah- with 16649 votes is in a neck and neck fight with BJP's B Sriramulu who has registered 16531 till 10.30 AM. In Chamundeshwari, Siddaramaiah is trailing by massive margin 13,113 votes with 19390 against JD(S)' G T Devegowda's 32503 votes.
BJP leads in Ballari rural, Ballari urban, Kudalgi, Kampli and Siraguppa. Congress leads in 89- Hagaribommanahalli, 90- vijayanagar, Sandur and 88- Hadagali

#KarnatakaElections: As @BJP4Karnataka leads, supports awaits and cheers outside a counting center in #Bengaluru. #KarnatakaVerdict pic.twitter.com/0qGi6AQmgM

— Pushkar_TNIE (@pushkarv) May 15, 2018

#KarnatakaVerdict: BJP all set to form government. Despite doing well, JD (S) may have no role to play. @siddaramaiah AHINDA formula appears to hve led to backlash from other communities. Will KN open gateway to BJP in South ahead of 2019 is the next question

— GS Vasu (@gsvasu_TNIE) May 15, 2018
BS Yeddyurappa leads with 19,000 after 10th round
Minister H Anjaneya lost by 24,800 votes in Holalkere. BJP's Chandrappa wins.
BJP marching ahead to make a clean sweep in Coastal Karnataka. Leads in 17 seats out of 19 in Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada and Udupi districts

This is a historic win for BJP. I want to thank all the people of Karnataka for voting for us. Ab desh mein Congress khojo abhiyan chalega, kahaan rahegi pata nahi: Raman Singh, CM of Chhattisgarh. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/Fc9tao6paN

details.title: Congress, JD(S) ready to form government
details.content: We've accepted the people's mandate and it has come to a situation where no party has got the majority. We have approached JD (S) to form the government and we will be meeting the governor regarding the same, says Karnataka Congress chief G Parmeshwara.
We had a telephonic conversation with Deve Gowda ji & Kumaraswamy. They have accepted our offer. Hopefully, we will be together: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad

Whether the Congress manages to form a government by supporting JD(S) or not, they shouldn’t be criticised for trying. The BJP would be doing exactly the same thing if the positions were reversed.

— Omar Abdullah (@OmarAbdullah) May 15, 2018

Wait & watch, the cup will be ours: Saravana, JD(S) MLC. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/XVWTGYjN0A

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

JD(S) had always maintained that HD Kumaraswamy will be CM. As per results, we're doing everything to keep BJP out of power. Congress has extended its support, we have accepted it. details.title: JD(S) State President HD Kumaraswamy writes letter to governor
details.content: In the letter, Kumaraswamy says, "I have accepted the support extended by the Indian National Congress for forming the Government. I seek your appointment today evening between 5.30 PM and 6 PM."

#KarnatakaElectionsResults2018 supporters infront of former PM Devegowda' s Residence, all eyes on JDS
PC: tushar @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/rO4BOXL9Zh

— Ashwini M Sripad (@AshwiniMS_TNIE) May 15, 2018
"I'm here with our independent MLA. The independent MLA, Nagesh and other MLAs are with us. We have the numbers. We want a secular government in Karnataka," says DK Shivakumar, Congress.
I have taken an appointment with Karnataka Governor for 5 pm. We should be forming the govt as we are the single largest party : BS Yeddyurappa
Congress & JDS has 117, we need 111 to form the govt. Since we were in power, and we lost, we have given our support for JDS led govt. BJP has 104, we are ahead of them : Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress

Just now we met Governor because we are single largest party, and that he allows us to prove majority in the Assembly: BS Yeddyurappa

BJP Parliamentary Board to meet at 7 pm at party headquarters in Delhi today.

Entirely up to Governor to appoint anyone he thinks proper. He's expected to be guided by his assessment of who is likely to command majority support in the House. He's expected to appoint only that person as CM who is likely to command majority support: S Kashyap, Constitutional expert

details.title: Siddaramaiah of Congress and JD (S)'s HD Kumaraswamy address joint press conference at Raj Bhavan

details.content: Siddaramaiah addresses joint press conference with HD Kumaraswamy outside Raj Bhavan. He says, "we have made it very clear to the Governor that Congress will accord unconditional support to JDS to form government. Kumaraswamy has also submitted a letter for the same to the Governor. He will get list from Election Commission and take a decision within the framework of the law. BJP may try, BJP is known for it, but this time they will not succeed." Siddaramaiah. Democracy dictates that Government must be formed only if you have the numbers, we are a coalition with 118 seats. To form government 111 seats are needed, we have the right to form government under law."

I thank my sisters and brothers of Karnataka for steadfastly supporting the BJP’s development agenda and making BJP the single largest party in the state. I salute the stupendous work of @BJP4Karnataka Karyakartas who toiled round the clock and worked for the party.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 15, 2018

On this cheerful occasion, I wish to express my warm greetings and felicitations for the significant victory of BJP in Karnataka Assembly Elections, bellwethering a grand entry to South India. @AmitShah pic.twitter.com/rW6YphhI7S

— O Panneerselvam (@OfficeOfOPS) May 15, 2018

Delhi: Sushma Swaraj arrives for BJP Parliamentary Board meeting at BJP headquarters pic.twitter.com/7JYZ598zEM

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018
BJP President Amit Shah arrives for Parliamentary Board meeting at BJP headquarters.
BJP President Amit Shah arrives for Parliamentary Board meeting at BJP headquarters in New Delhi. (Shekhar Yadav | EPS)
Karnataka BJP legislative party meeting scheduled to be held at 10:30 am tomorrow. (ANI)

details.title: Options before Karnataka governor
details.content: With no party reaching the halfway mark, the ball is now in the court of Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Rudabhai Vala. Click here to find the five options before the governor to form the next government.

BJP President Amit Shah welcomes PM Narendra Modi at BJP Headquarters in Delhi pic.twitter.com/TF3GuZFs0d

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

Have shown that Congress & JD(S) have a clear majority. Yeddyurappa is saying that BJP's single largest party, but single largest party doesn't necessarily form govt. I think Governor should invite the groups having the majority: Congress leader Dinesh Gundu Rao

BJP President Amit Shah welcomes PM Narendra Modi at BJP Headquarters in Delhi pic.twitter.com/TF3GuZFs0d

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

This is the 15th election. BJP has already won the last 14 elections. This is the 15th consecutive election where BJP is going to win: Amit Shah, BJP President in Delhi pic.twitter.com/fA4SdherXd

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018
This is the 15th election. BJP has already won the last 14 elections. This is the 15th consecutive election where BJP is going to win: Amit Shah, BJP President in Delhi
In 2019 we will not only form the govt under the leadership of Modi Ji but also form a New India in 2022: Amit Shah
In 2019 we will not only form the govt under the leadership of Modi Ji but also form a New India in 2022: Amit Shah

I am happy about #Karnataka's victory but on the other hand, I am saddened by the loss of lives in Varanasi. I extend my condolences to the families of the deceased & assure that the government will do whatever it can to support these families: PM Narendra Modi pic.twitter.com/1HkDrH0342

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018
G Parameshwara of Congress to be the Deputy CM: Baiju Narajan, JD(S)

They say BJP is a party of Hindi speaking states. Are Goa, Gujarat, Maharashtra states in North East Hindi speaking states? No, BJP represents India. There was no barrier between people of Karnataka & me. I'll always cherish the affection I received from them: PM Narendra Modi pic.twitter.com/ycLr8Wsvhy

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

Delhi: Visuals from BJP Parliamentary board meeting at BJP Headquarters pic.twitter.com/IQRIcfGoI7

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

details.title: Will fight for you: Rahul Gandhi tells Karnataka voters
details.content:
A big thank you to all those who voted for the Congress in these elections. We appreciate your support and will fight for you.

Thank you also to our workers and leaders for their dedication & untiring hard work in support of the party.

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) May 15, 2018
JD(S)' HD Deve Gowda & HD Kumaraswamy are in meeting with Congress leaders including Siddaramaiah, Ghulam Nabi Azad, DK Shivakumar and Mallikarjun Kharge in Bengaluru.

Tomorrow at 10:30 am in BJP legislative party meeting, I am going to be elected as party leader. After that all MLAs are going to meet the Governor to request him to allow BJP to form govt. Now the ball is in the court of the Governor. We will do as he decides: BS Yeddyurappa.

JD(S)'s HD Kumaraswamy has reached Ashoka Hotel for meeting senior Congress leaders including Siddaramaiah, Ghulam Nabi Azad, DK Shivakumar and Mallikarjun Kharge in Bengaluru. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/LZrOTYsEwR

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

I spoke to HD Kumaraswamy & congratulated him for his party’s victory. I am sure as he will discharge his constitutional responsibility in a better way as compared to his predecessors & Karnataka will progress under his leadership. Karnataka assembly results have brought down Muslim representation in the Assembly and this should be a cause of concern for every political party which believes in diversity & pluralism: AIMIM Chief, Asaduddin Owaisi.

H D Kumaraswamy would be the chief minister of the JDS-led government supported by the Congress, outgoing chief minister Siddaramaiah said today after a meeting between the two parties over a power deal. Siddaramaiah and Kumaraswamy also dismissed reports that a section of MLAs of their parties were unhappy over their joining hands in government formation.

details.title: Karnataka Polls 2018: Final Result Status
details.content:
Final result status of 222 seats: BJP wins 104 seats, Congress 78, JD(S) 37, Others 03. #KarnatakaElections2018 pic.twitter.com/7onozOvVAi

— ANI (@ANI) May 15, 2018

details.title: Former Karnataka CM and BJP leader Jagadish Shettar wins Hubli-Dharwad-Central
details.content:
The EC announces BJP's Jagadish Shettar as the winner from the Hubli-Dharwad-Central constituency. There was a mismatch between actual votes cast and actual votes reflected on the EVMs in this constituency. It reportedly showed 207 votes more than the actual number.

(ANI)

details.content:
Many important decisions in nation's interest will be taken up in #MonsoonSession2018 of Parliament. We hope for good suggestions and discussions from all experienced members: PM Modi pic.twitter.com/br2B9OJfaW

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Sloganeering by Opposition over mob lynching
details.content:
#MonsoonSession of Parliament is underway in Lok Sabha amidst sloganeering by members of opposition over recent cases of mob lynching.
